definition: used to express futurity
examples: tomorrow morning I will wake up in this first-class hotel suite
— Tennessee Williams

definition: used to express desire, choice, willingness, consent, or in negative constructions refusal
examples: no one would take the job
if we will all do our best
will you please stop that racket

definition: used to express a command, exhortation, or injunction
examples: you will do as I say, at once

definition: used to express frequent, customary, or habitual action or natural tendency or disposition
examples: will get angry over nothing
will work one day and loaf the next

definition: used to express probability and often equivalent to the simple verb
examples: that will be the babysitter

definition: used to express inevitability
examples: accidents will happen

definition: used to express determination, insistence, persistence, or willfulness
examples: I have made up my mind to go and go I will

definition: used to express capability or sufficiency
examples: the back seat will hold three passengers

definition: desire, wish
examples: call it what you will

definition: to have a wish or desire
examples: whether we will or no

definition: if you wish to call it that
examples: a kind of preoccupation, or obsession if you will
— Louis Auchincloss

definition: a legal declaration of a person's wishes regarding the disposal of his or her property or estate after death, a written instrument legally executed by which a person makes disposition of his or her estate to take effect after death
desire, wish: such as
disposition, inclination
examples: where there's a will there's a way

definition: appetite, passion
choice, determination
the act, process, or experience of willing : volition
mental powers manifested as wishing, choosing, desiring, or intending
a disposition to act according to principles or ends
the collective desire of a group
examples: the will of the people

definition: the power of control over one's own actions or emotions
examples: a man of iron will

definition: something desired, a choice or determination of one having authority or power
the part of a summons expressing a royal command, request, command
as one wishes : as or when it pleases or suits oneself
to cause or change by an act of will, to try to do so
examples: believed he could will himself to succeed

definition: intend, purpose
decree, ordain
examples: Providence wills it

definition: to determine by an act of choice
to dispose of by or as if by a will : bequeath
examples: willed his entire estate to his son

definition: to order or direct by a will
examples: willed that her property be divided among her children

definition: to exercise the will
choose
examples: do as you will
